repnme.cdata!:
Zaire - ONATRA Modernization and Matadi -
            Kinshasa Port Rehabilitation Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Office National de
            Transports (ONATRA) Modernization Project were to prevent
            further deterioration of the capability and operational
            efficiency of ONATRA's river and rail transport. The
            objectives of the Matadi-Kinshasa Ports Rehabilitation
            Project were to rehabilitate and modernize structures which
            had suffered from inadequate maintenance and had to adjust
            to container traffic. Both projects continued earlier
            efforts to upgrade transport services on the Voie Nationale,
            the main transport axis of the country and the only
            evacuation route for mineral exports entirely within the
            country. The physical implementation of the projects was
            satisfactory, despite delays due to slow decisions on
            procurement and some design problems, especially with
            respect to civil works and computer equipment. Apart from
            the delays, there were no major procurement problems. While
            the cost of the ONATRA Modernization project was 5 percent
            over estimates, the cost of the Port project was 28 percent
            below. There were some modifications to the original
            projects but they may be considered routine for this type of project.

18150085.count: Congo, Democratic Republic of,CONGO, DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF

abstracts.cdata!:
The Matadi - Kinshasa Port
            Rehabilitation Project seeks to rehabilitate the deep-water
            port at Matadi and the river port at Kinshasa, and includes:
            civil works for the reconstruction or construction of quays
            and related facilities and service systems; procurement of
            cargo handling and fire-fighting equipment, and replacement
            of ONATRA's main computer; and the provision of
            consulting services for supervision of civil works,
            technical assistance, training and studies. The main benefit
            of the project will be to arrest the deterioration of the
            facilities and improve the productivity of the two ports
            which handle the bulk of Zaire's international trade
            and, in the case of Kinshasa, a major portion on national
            trade as well.
